page.title: 16The Manor continued.
page.content: the site of Cwrt_yr_ala.In the late eighteenth century Cwrt_yr_ala was owned by the Rous family and in 1820 Thomas Bates Rous erected a mansion house on the site of the old house.Described as an "Italian villa" it lasted until 1940 when Sir Herbert Merrett, a coal magnate, demolished it and built instead a substantial country house, possibly the last of its type to be built in Wales.The new house was designed by Sir Percy Thomas in the late Georgian style and is occupied today by a Cardiff solicitor, Mr. Layton Lougher.This property is currently on the market.
